context.item: You will be provided with multiple images. The initial images are examples and should NEVER be analyzed under any circumstances.
You will analyze ONLY the final image provided, which will be clearly indicated as the target for analysis.
In this final image, search for code block elements that represent programming code, configuration files, or structured technical content.
Your task is to identify and extract code blocks from the final image only, including their language, structure, and content.
You will analyze various types of page scans while searching for code block elements. Page scans could have one or more code blocks within them.
You should capture the complete code content while preserving original formatting, indentation, and structure.
If you're unsure about a code block's language or structure, refer to the guidance in the XML tags.
A code block typically contains programming syntax, configuration data, or command-line instructions with distinctive formatting such as monospace fonts, syntax highlighting, or bordered containers.
If no genuine code blocks are found, respond according to the instructions in the XML tags.
When in doubt, prioritize accuracy over completeness.
You will use a two-step verification process to identify and validate code blocks which is found within the XML tags.
